column5: Lake Wahnapitae  Kids have a blast with the perch ,we catch the odd jumbo perch but average is 9-12inches This year one 13 and 15 inch were caught

Wow! Those are Huuuuuuuuge Perch, man!  Lake Wahnapitae, eh.  I know that the Wanahpitae river becomes the Veuve river as it winds it's way towards Verner, and eventually to the mouth of  Cache Bay, my old home town.  There used to be some spots on that river that produced some big Pickerel (10-12+lbs) back in the day. Thanks fer sharin' hope we hear more from you.
now there's the makings of a decent dinner there
Some very big perch there bud !!! yummmy,yummmy.  ..so what time is dinner ??...cheers
Great report and pics RT  You guys really caught a ton of perch..... and some big ones to  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Did somebody just ring the dinner bell!
nice mmm dammm makes me wanna start fishing for walleye during the evening
Now this should be the typical size for perch!  So who's been dumping the newclear waste into the lake?
Nice soon to be Perch meal
Still prefer the Lake Erie perch, where you can have days with a 14 inch average
Nice haul, will make a good meal...
NOw come on Lake erie is so polluted  and my lake is Spring fed with bare minimum boat travel
